page.title: 11Transport in Aith
page.content: As Aith is not on a main road cars are almost essential to every day life. Of the 201 people in the block, 154 own cars. There is a garage in the village which services, repairs and deals in cars. It sells petrol, as does the shop. Daily bus services running on the main west road can be connected with at Bixter, about 3 miles away. A minibus service is run for this purpose once a week. An old folks bus takes old people to Lerwick once a week.The school children from the surrounding district go to school by bus. Tractors are used for work on the crofts and to transport peats etc. A few young people have motorcycles and some crofts have trikes for rounding up the sheep on the hill. Many children have bicycles and some of the local children cycle to school.
